ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained immeasurable knowledge and understanding about the nature of Genius as well as how to analyze the personal lives of intellectuals.
In studying the history and lives of the geniuses discussed in this course, I learned about enablers of extraordinary intellect which might be applicable in achieving my own goals.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was effective not only at providing a diversity of learning opportunities through museum visits, guest lectures as well as a well chosen collection of readings that were both engaging and meaningful. This is the best course I've taken at yale so I have no complaints

In terms of classification, while this course indeed counts for a writing credit, I don't think my writing particularly benefited from taking this class. The day-to-day work was tedious; in-class quizzes going over reading from the night before felt unnecessary, and turned the essentially converted otherwise interesting essays and articles into assignments of memorization. In addition, I felt as though Professor Wright's comments on my essay had little to do with an actual critique of my writing, but rather more of a personal gripes about of my own style of taking the course in general.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend it to anyone interested in improving writing and the nature of genius

This course covered a lot of material on many geniuses. Many of the readings for the class were interesting. The workload was not overbearing and the 5 essays of the class were very doable. Overall, a very intriguing class.
